metadata.Title: CVE-2019-6798 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in phpMyAdmin before 4.8.5. A vulnerability wasreported where a specially crafted username can be used to trigger a SQLinjection attack through the designer feature.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-6798` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.6-5ubuntu0.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.6-5ubuntu0.5').
